title.narrative: Dissemination of Results on Abortion Incidence Study

description.narrative: Influential people: Policy makers (Parliamentarians), Government ministries, women's coalition, Health workers, NGOs, Activists, community leadership and media

The University of Zimbabwe-University of California San Francisco Collaborative Research Program (UZ-UCSF; now called the University of Zimbabwe College of Health Sciences Clinical Trials Unit or UZCHS-CTU) partnered with the Guttmacher Institute to carry out an abortion incidence and morbidity study in Zimbabwe. The research was aimed at filling a major gap in the evidence base by producing and widely disseminating the first-ever national estimates of unsafe abortion, and abortion-related complications in Zimbabwe. Women’s Action Group (WAG) has now partnered Guttmacher Institute in the dissemination of the study results. There are a number of activities that have to be implemented under this initiative. The first activity is a Women’s Health Conference which is aimed at; raising awareness on maternal mortality and morbidity in Zimbabwe and its causes, initiating dialogue on maternal health issues including unsafe abortion. WAG will also facilitate a high level dissemination workshop for the study results which will be attended by obstetricians and gynaecologists, members of parliament, government ministries, civil society, media and academia. WAG will ensure publicity of research findings through media, this will include a press conference and other forms of print media. Results of the study will also be disseminated at community level.
• To disseminate findings of the Zimbabwe Abortion Incidence and Morbidity Study • To develop strategies for addressing unsafe abortions and abortion complications in Zimbabwe
First disbursement for Women's Health Indaba
